connector.description: Store and retrieve objects from Minio Storage Service using Minio SDK.

camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

camel.source.endpoint.customHttpClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.customHttpClient
camel.source.endpoint.customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

camel.source.endpoint.endpoint.name: camel.source.endpoint.endpoint
camel.source.endpoint.endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

camel.source.endpoint.minioClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.minioClient
camel.source.endpoint.minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

camel.source.endpoint.policy.name: camel.source.endpoint.policy
camel.source.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.source.endpoint.secure.name: camel.source.endpoint.secure
camel.source.endpoint.secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncrypti.name: camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey
camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncrypti.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

camel.source.endpoint.autoCloseBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCloseBody
camel.source.endpoint.autoCloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the MinioObject.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.bypassGovernanceMo.name: camel.source.endpoint.bypassGovernanceMode
camel.source.endpoint.bypassGovernanceMo.description: Set this flag if you want to bypassGovernanceMode when deleting a particular object.

camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from Minio after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the MinioConstants#BUCKET_NAME and MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME headers, or only the MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME header.

camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.name: camel.source.endpoint.delimiter
camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeBody
camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the Minio object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders
camel.source.endpoint.includeFolders.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to set include folders.

camel.source.endpoint.includeUserMetadat.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeUserMetadata
camel.source.endpoint.includeUserMetadat.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with user meta data.

camel.source.endpoint.includeVersions.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeVersions
camel.source.endpoint.includeVersions.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with versioning.

camel.source.endpoint.length.name: camel.source.endpoint.length
camel.source.endpoint.length.description: Number of bytes of object data from offset.

camel.source.endpoint.matchETag.name: camel.source.endpoint.matchETag
camel.source.endpoint.matchETag.description: Set match ETag parameter for get object(s).

camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections
camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the minio client configuration

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

camel.source.endpoint.modifiedSince.name: camel.source.endpoint.modifiedSince
camel.source.endpoint.modifiedSince.description: Set modified since parameter for get object(s).

camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

camel.source.endpoint.notMatchETag.name: camel.source.endpoint.notMatchETag
camel.source.endpoint.notMatchETag.description: Set not match ETag parameter for get object(s).

camel.source.endpoint.objectName.name: camel.source.endpoint.objectName
camel.source.endpoint.objectName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given object name.

camel.source.endpoint.offset.name: camel.source.endpoint.offset
camel.source.endpoint.offset.description: Start byte position of object data.

camel.source.endpoint.recursive.name: camel.source.endpoint.recursive
camel.source.endpoint.recursive.description: List recursively than directory structure emulation.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.startAfter.name: camel.source.endpoint.startAfter
camel.source.endpoint.startAfter.description: list objects in bucket after this object name.

camel.source.endpoint.unModifiedSince.name: camel.source.endpoint.unModifiedSince
camel.source.endpoint.unModifiedSince.description: Set un modified since parameter for get object(s).

camel.source.endpoint.useVersion1.name: camel.source.endpoint.useVersion1
camel.source.endpoint.useVersion1.description: when true, version 1 of REST API is used.

camel.source.endpoint.versionId.name: camel.source.endpoint.versionId
camel.source.endpoint.versionId.description: Set specific version_ID of a object when deleting the object.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.accessKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessKey
camel.source.endpoint.accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.source.endpoint.secretKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.secretKey
camel.source.endpoint.secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket
camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

camel.component.minio.customHttpClient.name: camel.component.minio.customHttpClient
camel.component.minio.customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

camel.component.minio.endpoint.name: camel.component.minio.endpoint
camel.component.minio.endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

camel.component.minio.minioClient.name: camel.component.minio.minioClient
camel.component.minio.minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

camel.component.minio.policy.name: camel.component.minio.policy
camel.component.minio.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

camel.component.minio.proxyPort.name: camel.component.minio.proxyPort
camel.component.minio.proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

camel.component.minio.region.name: camel.component.minio.region
camel.component.minio.region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.minio.secure.name: camel.component.minio.secure
camel.component.minio.secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

camel.component.minio.serverSideEncrypti.name: camel.component.minio.serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey
camel.component.minio.serverSideEncrypti.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

camel.component.minio.autoCloseBody.name: camel.component.minio.autoCloseBody
camel.component.minio.autoCloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the MinioObject.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

camel.component.minio.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.minio.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.minio.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.minio.bypassGovernanceMo.name: camel.component.minio.bypassGovernanceMode
camel.component.minio.bypassGovernanceMo.description: Set this flag if you want to bypassGovernanceMode when deleting a particular object.

camel.component.minio.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.component.minio.deleteAfterRead
camel.component.minio.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from Minio after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the MinioConstants#BUCKET_NAME and MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME headers, or only the MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME header.

camel.component.minio.delimiter.name: camel.component.minio.delimiter
camel.component.minio.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.component.minio.includeBody.name: camel.component.minio.includeBody
camel.component.minio.includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the Minio object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.

camel.component.minio.includeFolders.name: camel.component.minio.includeFolders
camel.component.minio.includeFolders.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to set include folders.

camel.component.minio.includeUserMetadat.name: camel.component.minio.includeUserMetadata
camel.component.minio.includeUserMetadat.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with user meta data.

camel.component.minio.includeVersions.name: camel.component.minio.includeVersions
camel.component.minio.includeVersions.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with versioning.

camel.component.minio.length.name: camel.component.minio.length
camel.component.minio.length.description: Number of bytes of object data from offset.

camel.component.minio.matchETag.name: camel.component.minio.matchETag
camel.component.minio.matchETag.description: Set match ETag parameter for get object(s).

camel.component.minio.maxConnections.name: camel.component.minio.maxConnections
camel.component.minio.maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the minio client configuration

camel.component.minio.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.component.minio.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.component.minio.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

camel.component.minio.modifiedSince.name: camel.component.minio.modifiedSince
camel.component.minio.modifiedSince.description: Set modified since parameter for get object(s).

camel.component.minio.moveAfterRead.name: camel.component.minio.moveAfterRead
camel.component.minio.moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

camel.component.minio.notMatchETag.name: camel.component.minio.notMatchETag
camel.component.minio.notMatchETag.description: Set not match ETag parameter for get object(s).

camel.component.minio.objectName.name: camel.component.minio.objectName
camel.component.minio.objectName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given object name.

camel.component.minio.offset.name: camel.component.minio.offset
camel.component.minio.offset.description: Start byte position of object data.

camel.component.minio.recursive.name: camel.component.minio.recursive
camel.component.minio.recursive.description: List recursively than directory structure emulation.

camel.component.minio.startAfter.name: camel.component.minio.startAfter
camel.component.minio.startAfter.description: list objects in bucket after this object name.

camel.component.minio.unModifiedSince.name: camel.component.minio.unModifiedSince
camel.component.minio.unModifiedSince.description: Set un modified since parameter for get object(s).

camel.component.minio.useVersion1.name: camel.component.minio.useVersion1
camel.component.minio.useVersion1.description: when true, version 1 of REST API is used.

camel.component.minio.versionId.name: camel.component.minio.versionId
camel.component.minio.versionId.description: Set specific version_ID of a object when deleting the object.

camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.minio.accessKey.name: camel.component.minio.accessKey
camel.component.minio.accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.component.minio.secretKey.name: camel.component.minio.secretKey
camel.component.minio.secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.
